page.title: 11A Farm _ Kelfield Grange
page.content: Kelfield Grange Farm lies between 14' and 28' above sea-level, and consists of 95.8 hectares of mainly Grade 1 land on which mixed farming is carried out. Wheat, barley and oats are grown, along with potatoes, sugar beet, peas and beans.{ { In addition 15.4 hectares of {grassland are reserved for grazing, {hay_making, and silage. On this are {reared approximatly 50 beef cattle {from either farm bred, or bought_in {one month old calves. When two years {old they are sold. The cattle are {crossed French bread Limousin, {Simmental and Charollais.} Artificial fertilizers suppliment the manure from the cattle. Weeds and insects are controlled by regular use of herbicides and pesticides.
